overview_metadata.overview_subtitle: Area and Perimeter of Polygons on the Coordinate Plane
overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students consider real-world situations requiring them to use the Distance Formula to calculate the perimeter and area of polygons on a coordinate plane. They divide a composite figure into various known polygons to compute its area. They model real-world situations as polygons on a coordinate plane to solve problems.

overview_item_data_items: I can use the Distance Formula to solve real-world problems involving perimeter.
I can apply coordinate geometry to estimate the area of irregularly shaped figures.
I can determine the perimeter and area of composite figures on the coordinate plane.
I can decompose polygons into familiar shapes to calculate their area.
To calculate a composite figure's area, you can decompose it into polygons with known area formulas, compute the areas, and calculate the sum.
You can solve real-world problems with perimeter and area.
You can estimate the area of an irregularly shaped figure by making it resemble a polygon.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students share thoughts about a polygon representing the approximate shape of France.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Perimeter and Area of a Composite Figure
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students calculate the area of composite figures on the coordinate plane and solve real-world problems involving perimeter and area.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Solving Problems with Perimeter and Area
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students solve real-world perimeter and area problems and relate distance traveled to the area under a (rate) x (time) graph.
Students estimate France's area using a map on the coordinate plane and apply population density to estimate its population.
